dialogues.text: Unless you have other plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other plans? She swears in Italian. Obscenities. Then throws herself around JACK and squeezes him with all her strength. There tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Signor Eduardo Farfalla. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRIGGER FINGER squeezes. The SOCIMI SUBMACHINE fires. An EXPLOSIVE BULLET travels down the chamber at approxima 360 miles per hour headed straight for JACK's temporal lo Only it never gets there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun jams. A chamber explosion is a nasty thing. Instead of shooting of the barrel, the round explodes in the cannon's chamber Hot shrapnel fragments like a land mine, ripping into MATHILDE's hands, forearms and face...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTEL DEL MONTE, TOWN SQUARE- DAY
dialogues.text: A loud BANG pulls JACK and CLARA apart. Amidst the noise the festival, no one else seems to notice. JACK looks in the direction of the HOTEL ROOF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone got what was coming to them. He turns to her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to your apartment and pack. Wait `till I get there. Don't answer the door to anyone but me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eduardo, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you. She wants to, but she doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara. My name is not Eduardo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. She looks worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise you're not married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise. Take this. He hands her an ENVELOPE. It contains his final instalmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look after it. In case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perplexed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case? He wants to say it but he can't bring himself to. In case this is goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET- DAY
dialogues.text: LARRY is waiting on the corner of the town square. He is dialling and re-dialling a number in his mobile pho scanning the crowds around him. In the two seconds it takes the TAXI to pass by, JACK ste free of a row cars on the other side of the street. As LARRY comes into view again, JACK sees the STERLING SUBMACHINE GUN in his hands. And LARRY sees JACK. LARRY'S FINGER tightens on the trigger. L'AMERICANO throws himself to one side. There is a quick burst of popping explosions: ripping alo the line of parked cars. PANIC erupts. JACK is about to fire back at LARRY but LARRY takes cover behind a TOURIST and fires back another brief burst. JACK is hit in the shoulder. He drops his gun... ...and retrieves it just as LARRY fires again. SCREAMS spread through the holiday crowd like a wave of f moving down the street and spilling into the town square.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TOWN SQUARE- DAY
dialogues.text: JACK runs into the square. LARRY pursues him, firing for a third time. The buzz of spent rounds and the crack of muzzle fire ech around the square, bouncing off the walls and confusing t crowd. People start to run in different directions- everyone hea for the maze of alleys that surround the main square. ALTAR BOYS scatter. So do the LOCAL MEN carrying the STAT OF SAINT DOMINIC. The STATUE tumbles and smashes. Escapin SNAKES writhe. FATHER BENEDETTO takes cover. The two LOCAL CARABINIERI in their Land Rover get caught in the chaos. Confused, they turn on their SIRENS. LARRY spots JACK in the crowd and fires a fourth time. One TOURIST is killed outright, another injured JACK dives for cover behind the STATUE OF THE EAGLE where spotted Clara. Bullets ricochet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too old for this life, Jack. LARRY struggles for breath as he reloads. This is JACK's chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get sentimental then you fuck things up. Rolling along the steps to the statue of the eagle, JACK spreads his legs, faces LARRY and fires the customary TWO PRECISION-ENGINEERED SHOTS that make up a military-style execution: The first shot hits LARRY in the heart. LARRY is thrown backwards against a parked car, accidentally altering his of fire as slugs bounce off the steps beside JACK, chips marble stinging against his calves. Again, JACK takes aim. A beat as his finger tightens on the trigger. HEADSHOT. Half LARRY'S FACE is wiped out of existence. Wh left of him slides down the parked car onto both knees. H hand flashes to his mangled throat then drops. He falls forwards and his STERLING clatters on the cobble stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete silence. Not even the sound of a siren. The town square is empty. Except for FATHER BENEDETTO hiding in the wreckage of the broken STATUE. Jack's WALTHER hangs ominously by his side. FATHER BENEDETTO stands unsteadily. Like lightening JACK spins, instinctively raising his WAL and zeroing in on FATHER BENEDETTO. His face is devoid of emotion. He is a bloody machine looking at a potential target. We hear SIRENS. Across a slew of dead bodies, JACK keeps the gun pointed FATHER BENEDETTO. FATHER BENEDETTO stands stock still, facing JACK. The SIRENS get louder. JACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will you tell them? A beat. FATHER BENEDETTO takes something from inside his Soutane. And holds it up with a trembling hand. JACK'S LETTER. FATHER BENEDETTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will them that the man who wrote this letter is my friend. FATHER BENEDETTO smiles sadly. FATHER BENEDETTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack. FATHER BENEDETTO shuts his eyes, muttering a quiet prayer The SIRENS get closer. We hear Carabinieri screeching to a halt and clambering o of their cars, cocking submachine guns. When FATHER BENEDETTO opens his eyes again... ...JACK has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. CASTEL DEL MONTE- DAY
dialogues.text: Using his meticulous knowledge of the alleyways and lanes that make up the medieval heart of the town, JACK avoids CARABINIERI and, stealing a bicycle, makes it onto the ma road before a road block has been set up.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. L'AQUILA, COACH STATION, LEFT LUGGAGE- DAY
dialogues.text: JACK collects a sports bag from a LOCKER.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. L'AQUILA, COACH STATION, BATHROOM- DAY
dialogues.text: JACK washes the blood from his hands.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. L'AQUILA, COACH STATION, MAIN HALL- DAY
dialogues.text: When he emerges from the bathroom JACK is wearing the clo of a fifty year-old American tourist from the mid-West wi glasses and a baseball cap. He checks the time of next bus to Rome. Then glances at his watch. He has thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. L'AQUILA, STREET- DAY
dialogues.text: JACK walks towards Clara's APARTMENT BUILDING. Two hundred metres up ahead, two OFFICERS of the Guardia Finanza wait in an unmarked car. JACK walks past Clara's APARTMENT BUILDING. And keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. L'AQUILA, COACH STATION- DAY
dialogues.text: The BUS for Rome is barely half-full. Blending in perfectly with a group of middle aged America tourists, JACK boards the steps, purchases a ticket and t a seat at the rear.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. AUTOSTRADA- DAY
dialogues.text: A long tunnel: one of the longest in Europe. JACK alone at the back of the BUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like night: red stripes, strip lights, shadows. Vast fans suspended from the ceiling shift the traffic fu A button of light, expanding... ...as we burst into daylight. THE END.
